titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ronald Anthony Cross Papers, 1971-2019 and undated RL.11756
titlestmt.author: Alice Poffinberger and Emile Therrien

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-08-07 13:56:24 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Ronald Anthony Cross was an American science fiction and fantasy author. Collection includes a wide array of Cross' creative work, including short stories and novelettes, poems, essays, song lyrics, novels, and copies of his published work. In addition there is research he conducted for his published books, and often material related to the publishing process, including tracking sheets, correspondence, contracts, reviews, and royalty statements. Material dated past Cross' death has to do with republishing agreements.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Writings, Research, and Correspondence.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ronald Anthony Cross was born on 1937 September 12 in Hollywood California and died on 2006 March 1, in Sherman Oaks, Los Angeles, California. He was an American science fiction and fantasy author.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The donor must be contacted about individual publication requests and individual requests related to commercial use of these materials.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Ronald Anthony Cross Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ronald Anthony Cross Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Alice Poffinberger and Emile Therrien, August, 2019
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2019-0052
Material may not be organized beyond its original order.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Includes a wide array of Cross' creative work, including short stories and novelettes, poems, essays, song lyrics, novels, and copies of his published work. In addition there is research he conducted for his published books, and often material related to the publishing process, including tracking sheets, correspondence, contracts, reviews, and royalty statements. Material dated past Cross' death has to do with republishing agreements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a wide array of Cross' creative work, including short stories and novelettes, poems, essays, song lyrics, novels, and copies of his published work. Drafts and copy edited versions of his writings are often accompanied by a variety of other material, including Cross' tracking documents, correspondence, contracts, royalty payments, reviews, photocopies of the published piece, and other items related to the publishing process.

All the Way to Teelee Town
The Beautiful People are Dying Off
Conman and Le Guin satires and King Kong and Fellowship of the Ring

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series contains all the descendants of Noah

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes primarily research Cross conducted for his published books. Among the material are style sheets; notes, lists, and questions regarding the works; photocopies of internet and other research completed, and reference materials. Includes some correspondence with publishers. There is a review of White Guardian, and a list of Cross' recommended readings.

did.unittitle: Lost Guardian Reference, Materials, and Lists
Lost Guardian Biblio, Notes, Questions, etc.
Xerox Info re Richard, Durnstein Pics, etc.
White G Notes, Questions and Correspondence
White G- Review in Realms of Fantasy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence regarding the publishing and review of Crosses work, along with contracts. Cross also comments on the work of other writers and his own unpublished work. In addition, there are files on royalty statements and the Nebula Awards. Material dated past Cross' death involves republication of his work.
